title: My League of Legends Problem: PLEASE HELP ASAP!
body: Guys l have this problem for over 6 months, l tried creating a new account on my Windows, cleaning regist via CCleaner and a lot o other things. When i want to reinstall it it says that l already have league on my computer but when l search it on computer there is no League. There is no League not even in the Unninstal section of Control panel. But when l open the CCleaner and try to unninstall using it lt says this : "The feature you are trying to use is on a network resource that is unavailable. Click OK to try again, or enter an alternate path to a folder containing package 'LoL.NA.msi' in the box below" and it shows me the path. When l press OK it says : " The path . . . cannot be found. Verify that you have access to this location and try again, or try to find the installation folder which you can install the product League of Legends" And l press OK again and iit says: "Installation source ffor this product is not available. Verify that the source exists and then you can access it". And nothing . Guys please HELP!

replies.body:
Hmmm, have you attempted a clean reinstall using our [Hextech Repair Tool](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/224826367)? Simply boot up the app, check the boxes for *reinstall* and *clean uninstall* and let it work its magic. 

Let me know if this worked for you!

So you want to install League of Legends? But it says that you already have it installed and it makes you not able to install League of Legends?
It's not in the uninstall section......

Have you tried to delete available League of Legends files? You can search in the search box at the windows 4 square circle '' League of Legends '' and delete remaining files/folders and then try to install it? I don't know how this works but it could work? Anyways I wish you best of luck!

Best wishes, A Kat Main {{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}
